results.title: As tears go by
results.creator_credit: Wong, Rover Tang and In-gear Film
results.brief_description: Wong Kar-wai describes his first feature as ‘a tragedy set in the big city, focussing on several ordinary characters in a hopeless situation’. It has also been described as ‘an idiosyncratic riff on the plot and themes of Scorsese’s Mean Streets’. Ah Wah (Andy Lau) is an enigmatic hit man who, with his offsider Fly (Jacky Cheung), is, despite himself, dragged into trouble time and time again. The arrival of his cousin (Maggie Cheung) briefly offers hope of escape from the downward spiral. The emphasis is more on atmosphere and interplay between the three characters than upon plot. In Cantonese with English subtitles.

results.title: Pretty village pretty flame = Lepa sela lepo gore
results.creator_credit: Srdjan Dragojevic, Goran Bjelogrlic and Cobra Film Development
results.brief_description: Set in the early days of the Bosnian War, this film is based around the relationship of two young men who find themselves on opposing sides in the conflict. Holed up in a tunnel, the Serbian soldiers strive to maintain their bawdy sense of humour while under siege from Muslim soldiers who are torturing and killing those around them. The continuing problem of accountability is highlighted, as soldiers on each side deny responsibility for the atrocities which have affected the other. Meanwhile, their country is torn apart. A powerful anti-war film that conveys the futility of war through the often ironic use of popular music, including a rendition of John Lennon’s “Give peace a chance”. In Serbian with English subtitles.

results.title: The Daytrippers
results.creator_credit: Greg Mottola, Steven Soderbergh, Nancy Tenenbaum, Trick Film Studios and Fiasco Photoplays
results.brief_description: This low budget gem is a charming take on the road movie genre which balances equal amounts of humour and melancholy as it traces a day in the life of a middle class American family. The films events are set off by a love letter that is discovered one morning by Eliza D’Amico (Hope Davis), which is addressed to her husband Louis (Stanley Tucci) and is signed, ‘Forever Sandy’. The distraught Eliza enlists the advice of her close knit family who decide the best course of action is to head into the city and confront Louis at work. So Eliza, her parents, her younger sister Jo (Parker Posey), and her sister’s bookish boyfriend, Carl (Liev Schreiber), all jump in the family car and head to Manhattan. The film then takes on a classic road movie structure as they meet various people on their trip, suffer a few mishaps, and have their own personal revelations along the way. The script by first time director Greg Mottola is full of tender observations and sharp one liners, while the film boasts a wonderful ensemble cast which also includes Pat McNamara, Annie Meara and Campbell Scott.

results.title: The Acid house (D)
results.creator_credit: Paul McGuigan, Alex Usborne, David Muir and Channel 4 Television
results.brief_description: Three stories from Irvine Welsh’s first collection have been adapted in this tongue-in-cheek response to “Trainspotting” and the emergence of The Chemical Generation, a movement Welsh helped to spawn. “The Granton Star Cause”, “A Soft Touch” and “The Acid House” are lethal Scottish fables of drugs, booze and all that which is valued above humanity in the depths of post-Thatcher Britain. But they are also comedies, loud with pitch-black laughter that echoes across a bleak urban landscape where God spends his days in the pub and even the most successful search for identity only leads to hooliganism and excrement. Featuring an unusually intelligent pop-soundtrack, “The Acid House” is not a life-affirming comedy, but it is social commentary at its most painfully entertaining.

results.title: Final Cut
results.creator_credit: Ray Burdis, Dominic Anciano and Segma Limited
results.brief_description: Film makers Dominic Anciano and Ray Burdis have created an original rumination on friendship which blurs the line between documentary and fiction. Jude Law is a recently deceased film maker whose latest film is screened to his grieving family and friends on the day of his funeral. The group is shocked to find that over the last year Jude has in fact been filming them, using hidden cameras to record their most private moments and guilty secrets. Embarrassment gradually turns to fear as the film peels back the layers of their lives, each more treacherous than the last. With liberal use of improvisation and a tour-de-force performance from Ray Winstone, ‘Final Cut’ is a contemporary exploration of morality, mortality and the power of the recorded image. Cast also includes Sadie Frost, Dominic Anciano and Ray Burdis.

results.title: Shirley Valentine
results.brief_description: Pauline Collins is Shirley Valentine-Bradshaw, a housewife and mother in cold dull England who dreams of adventure and stimulation. Her best friend wins a holiday in Greece and Shirley decides to come along. On the beautiful island of Mykonos, Shirley finds herself increasingly attracted to fisherman Costas (Tom Conti), and before the whirl wind two weeks on the Aegean is finished, she has to make big decisions about whether to return to her middle-class life back in England or to pursue the adventures of a new life promised by Greece and Costa. With the magical locales of Mykonos as a backdrop, “Shirley Valentine” is a perennial crowd pleasing comedy which also manages to develop some perceptive insights into the emotions and experiences of women in the middle years of their lives.

results.title: The Killer nun = Suor omicidi [Widescreen]
results.creator_credit: Giulio Berruti, Enzo Gallo and Cinesud
results.brief_description: A former ‘video-nasty’ and one of the few examples of the perversely themed ‘nunsploitation’ genre, which is basically a thinly veiled excuse for some soft core erotica. The usual ingredients for this genre are all present in The Killer nun, that being drug addicted nuns, lesbianism, sadism, murder, necrophilia and lashings of nudity. Anita Ekberg stars as sister Gertrude a sexually repressed, morphine addicted nun who descends into madness when her elderly patients begin to get murdered, making her the prime suspect. Soon enough the unhinged sister is shooting up, having sex with strange men and making inappropriate advances at her fellow sisters. Cast includes Joe Dallesandro, Alida Valli, Lou Castel. Also known as Suor omicidi.

results.title: The Court jester
results.creator_credit: Melvin Frank, Norman Panama and Dena Enterprises
results.brief_description: Danny Kaye is the quintessential singing, dancing, royal clown in this classic musical comedy set in 12th century England which parodies Robin Hood style swashbuckling adventure films. He plays a court jester who accidentally falls in with a band of outlaws who are plotting to kill the king. They try to use the unwitting fool to get close to the king, however they do not reckon on his ability as a jouster as well as a jester, which brings their plans undone in a hilarious manner. Cast also includes Basil Rathbone, Angela Lansbury, Glynis Johns and Cecil Parker.

results.title: Pleasantville
results.creator_credit: Gary Ross, Steven Soderbergh, Robert J. Degus, Jon Kilik and New Line Cinema
results.brief_description: Dejected teenager David (Tobey Maguire) suffers all the complexities of 90s adolescence. Confronted by doomsaying school teachers and dwindling job prospects, David seeks refuge in his favourite TV show - an old-fashioned, black and white sitcom called Pleasantville. One fateful night a mysterious TV repairman transports David and his precocious sister Jennifer (Reese Witherspoon) inside the fantastic world of Pleasantville, where life is a curious routine of niceties and home-spun values. But the pair’s arrival turns everyday life on its head for the small town, until now untouched by concepts of sex, rebellion, and most notably, colour. An insightful satire of the American Dream, Pleasantville combines pioneering photographic techniques with a stellar cast including Joan Allen, J.T. Walsh, William H. Macy, Jeff Daniels and comic legend Don Knotts as the elusive TV repairman.

results.title: Psycho (1960) [DVD]
results.creator_credit: Alfred Hitchcock, Paramount Pictures and Shamley Productions
results.brief_description: Hitchcock’s macabre masterpiece broke all of the existing rules for horror films and filmmakers, set the standard for a generation of new ones and kept uncounted masses wary of entering showers. It remains a benchmark for the technique of audience manipulation. Undoubtedly Hitchcock’s most calculated work, he was ably supported by the extraordinary leading performances of Anthony Perkins as the psychotic motel owner and Janet Leigh as the hapless thief, reinforced by Bernard Herrmann’s evocatively dissonant musical score. Based on the novel by Robert Bloch.
